name: Wholl Stop The Rain
author: Creedence Clearwater Revival
text:
[G] [Em] [G]

[G]Long as I remember [C]the rain been comin' [G]down
[G]Clouds of mystery pourin' [C]confusion on the [G]ground
[C]Good men through the [G]ages
[C]Tryin' to find the [G]sun
[C]And I wonder [D]still I wonder
[Em]Who'll stop the rain    [G] 
 
[G]I went down Virginia seeking [C]shelter from the [G]storm
[G]Caught up in the [Bm]fable I [C]watched the tower [G]grow
[C]Five-year plans and [G]new deals
[C]Wrapped in golden [G]chains
[C]And I wonder, [D]still I wonder
[Em]Who'll stop the rain    [G] 
 
[C] [G] [D] [Am] [C] [Em] [D] [G]

[G]Heard the singers playin', [C]how we cheered for [G]more
The [G]crowd had rushed to[Bm]gether, just [C]tryin to keep [G]warm
[C]Still the rain kept [G]pourin'
[C]Fallin on my [G]ears
[C]And I wonder, [D]still I wonder
[Em]Who'll stop the rain...
